Body: Struggling with authentication using FONA on either Raspberry Pi 2 and 3 even while strictly following the Adafruit FONA setup instructions
column9:
the following steps helped me to get it work on both Pi's - based on a freshly installed raspbian/debian stretch OS. Adopt the following to your BBB:

  • update OS:

    sudo apt-get update	sudo apt-get dist-upgrade

  • install neccessary packages:

    sudo apt-get install ppp screen
  • connect FONA board to Pi/BBB as described within Adafruit FONA setup instructions

  • ensure you disabled kernel's use of hardware serial connection!

    Pi2: follow Adafruit description	Pi3: "sudo raspi-config" > "Interfacing Options" > "Serial"	> "...login shell... over serial?" NO	> "...serial port hardware enabled?" YES
  • exit/finish raspi config and

  • check

    sudo nano /boot/config.txt

  • if line enable_uart=1 is included. If not
column10:
add this as new line and save

[Ctrl]+[x]
column12:
[Enter] > reboot!

  • find the correct serial port for your Pi/BBB. This command might help - it shows all available ports:

    ls /dev

  • Examples:

    Pi2: "/dev/ttyAMA0"	Pi3: "/dev/serial0"	BBB: "/dev/tty04" (as stated at Adafruit)

  • Ensure that the FONA is answering on the corresponding serial port - in this example on Pi3:

    screen /dev/serial0 115200

  • A black screen (terminal window) should occur. Write

    AT [Enter]

  • and you should get OK as response. If you don't get the "OK"
column14:
reconnect it afterwards and give it another try! You can exit the terminal window at any time through

[Ctrl]+[A]	:quit [Enter]
